Bits information: 32| 28| 24| 20| 16| 12| 8| 4| 0| | | | | | | | | | 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 | | | | | [0000 0000] => PCAN-ISO-TP API errors | | | | | [0 0000] => CAN Bus status | | | | [00 000] => Networking message status | | [0000 00] => API extra information |[000 0000] => Reserved [0] => PCANBasic error flag (overrides the meaning of all bits)

Represents the PCANTP & UDS error and status codes.
Bits information: 32| 28| 24| 20| 16| 12| 8| 4| 0| | | | | | | | | | 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 | | | | | [0000 0000] => PCAN-ISO-TP API errors | | | | | [0 0000] => CAN Bus status | | | | [00 000] => Networking message status | | [0000 00] => PCAN-ISO-TP API extra information | [0 0000] => API Status | [0] => UDS Status |[0] => Reserved [0] => PCANBasic error flag

member.summary: Reads a PUDS message from the receive queue of a PUDS channel
member.param: A PCANTP channel handle representing a PUDS channel
[out]A uds_msg structure buffer to store the PUDS message

(Optional) If NULL the first available message is fetched. Otherwise in_msg_request must represent a sent PUDS request. To look for the request confirmation, in_msg_request->type should not have the loopback flag; otherwise a response from the target ECU will be searched.
A cantp_timestamp structure buffer to get the reception time of the message. If this value is not desired, this parameter should be passed as NULL
member.returns: A uds_status code. PUDS_STATUS_OK is returned on success

A sent uds_msg message used as a reference to find the waited message
States if the message to wait for is a transmit confirmation
Maximum time to wait (in milliseconds) for a message indication corresponding to the message request

member.name: M:Peak.Can.Uds.UDSApi.WaitForFunctionalResponses_2013(Peak.Can.IsoTp.cantp_handle,Peak.Can.Uds.uds_msg@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt32,Peak.Can.Uds.uds_msg[],System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Waits for multiple responses (from a functional request for instance) based on a PUDS message request.
member.remarks: Warning: The order of the parameters has changed in PCAN-UDS 2.0 API.

A sent uds_msg message used as a reference to find the waited message
Maximum time to wait (in milliseconds) for a message indication corresponding to the message request.
Maximum time to wait for a message indication if the server requested more time
if FALSE the function is interrupted if out_msg_count reaches max_msg_count.

a two-byte Data Identifier (see PUDS_SVC_PARAM_DI_xxx)
First byte can be used as either an inputOutputControlParameter that describes how the server shall control its inputs or outputs (see PUDS_SVC_PARAM_IOCBI_xxx), or as an additional controlState byte
Size in bytes of the control_option_record buffer

There shall be one bit in the control_enable_mask_record corresponding to each individual parameter defined within the dataIdentifier.

The blockSequenceCounter parameter value starts at 01 hex with the first TransferData request that follows the RequestDownload (34 hex) or RequestUpload (35 hex) service. member.remarks: See PCAN_BR_* values Bit rate string must follow the following construction rules: * parameters and values must be separated by '=' * Couples of Parameter/value must be separated by ',' * Following Parameter must be filled out: f_clock, data_brp, data_sjw, data_tseg1, data_tseg2, nom_brp, nom_sjw, nom_tseg1, nom_tseg2. * Following Parameters are optional (not used yet): data_ssp_offset, nom_sam
member.returns: A TPCANStatus error code
